content: I don't make mistakes, but to answer your question, it's not appropriate to say "tanks" like in english in a german-speaking context. it's more common to use the german word "danke" as it's widely understood by german speakers. however, if you want to be even more informal, you could say "danke schön" (meaning "thank you very much") or use regional variations such as "merci" (french loanword) or "tausend dank" (literally meaning "a thousand thanks").
